jcr:content.jcr:title: List of aircraft of the Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)

contentheadline.headline: List of aircraft of the Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)

contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=May 2009}} This is a '''list of aircraft of the [[Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)|Army Air Corps]]''' of the United Kingdom. ==Aircraft== From its founding in 1942: *[[Taylorcraft Auster]] *[[Auster AOP.6]] *[[General Aircraft Hotspur]] *[[General Aircraft Hamilcar]] *[[Airspeed Horsa]] *[[Waco Hadrian]] *[[Waco Standard Cabin series|Waco YKC]] and [[Waco Custom Cabin Series|ZGC-7]] - Two civil aircraft purchased by the British Army in [[Egypt]], the aircraft were used by the [[Long Range Desert Group]]. Since its separation from the [[Royal Air Force]] in [[1957 in aviation|1957]] ===Helicopters=== * [[Bell 212]] * [[Agusta A109]] * [[Alouette II|Sud Aviation Alouette II]] * [[Westland WAH-64 Apache|Westland Apache]] * [[AÃ©rospatiale Gazelle|Westland Gazelle]] * [[H-13 Sioux|Westland Sioux]]<ref>licence built Bell design by both Westland and Agusta</ref> * [[Saunders-Roe Skeeter]] * [[Westland Lynx]] * [[Westland Scout]] * [[Eurocopter AS350|Eurocopter Squirrel]] ===Fixed wing=== * [[Auster AOP.9]] * [[de Havilland Canada DHC-2 Beaver|DHC Beaver]] (now in the Army Historic Aircraft Flight) * [[de Havilland Canada DHC-1 Chipmunk|DHC Chipmunk]] (now in the Army Historic Aircraft Flight) * [[Britten-Norman Islander]]/[[Britten-Norman Defender|Defender]] * [[Slingsby T-67 Firefly|Slingsby Firefly T67M260]] (at [[No. 674 Squadron AAC|674 Squadron]], DEFTS) (left service in December 2010) * [[Slingsby T-67 Firefly|Slingsby Firefly 160]] (at Army Flying Grading) (left service in December 2010) * [[Grob Tutor]] light fixed wing trainer (at [[No. 674 Squadron AAC|674 Squadron]], DEFTS and Army Flying Grading) ===Missiles=== *[[SS.11]] - Obsolete air-to-surface, [[wire-guided]] [[anti-tank missile]]. *[[AGM-114 Hellfire]] - Air-to-surface, laser-guided anti-tank missile. *[[BGM-71 TOW]] - Air-to-surface, [[anti-tank guided missile]]. <!-- these are not part of the AAC ==List of missiles of the British Army== * [[Blowpipe missile|Blowpipe]] - Obsolete man portable [[surface-to-air missile]] from the 1970s. * [[FGM-148 Javelin]] - Light weight infantry [[anti-tank missile]]. * [[FIM-92 Stinger]] - Man portable [[surface-to-air missile]]. * [[Javelin surface-to-air missile|Javelin]] - Man portable [[surface-to-air missile]]. * [[MGM-5 Corporal]] - Obsolete [[surface-to-surface]] missile from the 1950s. * [[MGM-52 Lance]] - Obsolete [[surface-to-surface missile]]. * [[MGR-1 Honest John]] - Obsolete surface-to-surface rocket. * [[Malkara missile|Malkara]] - Obsolete Anglo-Australian [[anti-tank missile]]. * [[MILAN]] - Light weight infantry [[anti-tank missile]]. * [[Rapier missile|Rapier]] - Land-based [[surface-to-air missile]]. * [[Starburst surface-to-air missile|Starburst]] - Man portable [[surface-to-air missile]]. * [[Starstreak missile|Starstreak]] - Man portable [[surface-to-air missile]]. * [[Swingfire]] - Land-based [[anti-tank missile]]. * [[English Electric Thunderbird|Thunderbird]] - Obsolete [[surface-to-air missile]] from the 1950s and 1960s. * [[Vickers Vigilant]] - Obsolete [[anti-tank missile]] from the 1960s. <!-- these are not part of the AAC, Royal Artillery operates these ==drones and UAVs== * [[BAE Systems Phoenix]] * [[Canadair CL-89|Canadair CL-89 Midge]] * [[Lockheed Martin Desert Hawk]] * [[Radioplane BTT|Northrop MQM-57 (SD-1) Falconer or Peeping Tom]] * [[Watchkeeper WK450]] --> ==See also== *[[list of aircraft of the Royal Air Force]] *[[list of aircraft of the Fleet Air Arm]] ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.army.mod.uk/aviation/air.aspx Army Air Corps at official British Army website] [[Category:Army Air Corps]] [[Category:Lists of military aircraft|United Kingdom British Army Air Corps, List of aircraft of the]]
